thread.title: Lackey leads Cardinals to win against Cubs
thread.title_full: Lackey leads Cardinals to win against Cubs

title: Lackey leads Cardinals to win against Cubs
text:
Lackey leads Cardinals to win against Cubs Reuters – 9 minutes ago Print 
Reuters/Reuters - Oct 9, 2015; St. Louis, MO, USA; St. Louis Cardinals starting pitcher John Lackey (41) waves to fans after being pulled in the eighth inning of game one of the NLDS against the Chicago Cubs … more at Busch Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Jasen Vinlove-USA TODAY Sports less Related Content View Photo 
Oct 9, 2015; St. Louis, MO, USA; St. Louis Cardinals left fielder Stephen Piscotty … (Reuters) - John Lackey was masterful on the mound as the St. Louis Cardinals beat the Chicago Cubs 4-0 in the opener of their National League Division Series on Friday. 
Lackey carried a no-hitter into the sixth with precise command and left in the eighth after yielding just two hits, leaving relievers Kevin Siegrist and Trevor Rosenthal to complete a combined three-hit shutout. 
The Cardinals scored a run in the first and sealed the game with an eighth-inning, pinch-hit home run by Tommy Pham that was followed by a two-run homer from fellow-rookie Stephen Piscotty. 
The second game of the best-of-five series is on Saturday in St. Louis. 
(Reporting by Larry Fine in New York; Editing by Greg Stutchbury)
